meanings.definition: Exclude from a group or society
meanings.sent1: The new student felt ostracised by the others in the class.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, she was ostracised by her former friends.
meanings.sent3: The ostracised teddy bear sat alone on the shelf, feeling left out.
meanings.sent4: Her unique ideas were often ostracised by the traditional members of the team.
meanings.sent5: The ostracised bird chirped sadly outside the closed window.

meanings.sent1: He was ostracised by the community after his dishonest actions were revealed.
meanings.sent2: The group decided to ostracise the troublemaker to maintain peace.
meanings.sent3: The ostracised cat refused to come out from under the bed, sulking.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an ostracised island in the sea of unfamiliar faces.
meanings.sent5: The ostracised plant withered away in the neglected corner of the garden.
